verbose_text: In particular, they have abnormally high plasma levels of vWF and low ADAMTS13 activity to compensate thrombocytopenia and thrombocytopathia21 Takahashi et al found that vWFpp / vWF ratio and vWFpp / ADAMTS13 ratio were significantly higher in the weeks following LDLT compared with pretransplant values and to healthy patients.7 They also highlighted that the vWFpp / vWF ratio was significantly higher in those who developed TMA, and the vWFpp / ADAMTS13 ratio significantly higher in nonsurvivors compared with survivors.
